Job.title: Senior Product Manager
Product.Strategy: Positioning and product definition;Ecosystem management;Performance & Risk management
Product.Planning: Product life-cycle management;Roadmapping;Release planning;Product requirements engineering
roadmap.detailing: All tasks are planned and worked out in detail for short-,mid- and long term.
roadmap.items: Mainly product vision, customer and business goals, products, features and for the long-term timeframe themes (i.e., high-level customer needs)
roadmap.reliability: Mainly in regular review cycles (e.g., every 3 months)
roadmap.confidence: The impacts are mainly determined based on data from the past (e.g., statistics).
roadmap.discovery: Product roadmap items are mainly defined based on expert knowledge.
roadmap.prioritization: Prioritization is done with an established process and focuses on delivering value to customers and the business.
roadmap.alignment: One central product roadmap exists for different internal and external stakeholders.
roadmap.responsibility: Product  Management with cross-functional product teams in  liaison with key stakeholders.
info.sources: Tool vendor's material (e.g. blog, webinar, ebook)

Job.title: Product Manager
Strategic.Management: Corporate Strategy;Portfolio Management;Innovation Management;Resource Management;Market Analysis;Product Analysis
Product.Strategy: Positioning and product definition;Delivery model & Service strategy;Sourcing;Business case and costing;Pricing;Ecosystem management;Legal & PR management;Performance & Risk management
Product.Planning: Product life-cycle management;Roadmapping;Release planning;Product requirements engineering
Marketing: Marketing planning;Customer analysis;Opportunity Management;Marketing mix optimisation;Product launches (GTM);Operational marketing
roadmap.detailing: Short-term items are detailed, prioritized, estimated and validated. Mid-term items are under validation or being discovered. The long-term timeframe contains themes.
roadmap.confidence: The impacts are mainly determined based on data from the past (e.g., statistics).
roadmap.discovery: Close integration of discovery and delivery activities
roadmap.prioritization: Prioritization is done with an established process and focuses on delivering value to customers and the business.
roadmap.alignment: One central product roadmap exists for different internal and external stakeholders.
roadmap.responsibility: Product  Management with cross-functional product teams in  liaison with key stakeholders.
info.sources: Books (e.g. Roadmaps Relaunched, Escape the build trap);Blogs (e.g. Rich Mironov, Product Craft);Online communities (e.g. LinkedIn groups, Slack communtities);Tool vendor's material (e.g. blog, webinar, ebook)

Job.title: FP&A
roadmap.detailing: All tasks are planned and worked out in detail for short-,mid- and long term.
roadmap.reliability: Adjustments are mainly done reactively on demand.
roadmap.discovery: No discovery activities. Typically, a manager is defining the roadmap items.
roadmap.prioritization: Prioritization is based on short term benefit (e.g., shareholder value).
roadmap.alignment: No alignment. No one or only one stakeholder such as high level management has a product roadmap that is not communicated to others.
info.sources: Tool vendor's material (e.g. blog, webinar, ebook)

Job.title: Product Manager
roadmap.detailing: Short-term items are detailed, prioritized, estimated and validated. Mid-term items are under validation or being discovered. The long-term timeframe contains themes.
roadmap.reliability: Mainly in regular review cycles (e.g., every 3 months)
roadmap.discovery: Several discovery activities are conducted (e.g., user research) but they are not or only loosely integrated with  delivery  activities.
roadmap.prioritization: Prioritization is based on short term benefit (e.g., shareholder value).
roadmap.alignment: One central product roadmap exists for different internal and external stakeholders.
info.sources: Books (e.g. Roadmaps Relaunched, Escape the build trap);Blogs (e.g. Rich Mironov, Product Craft)

Job.title: Product Manager
Strategic.Management: Corporate Strategy;Portfolio Management;Innovation Management;Resource Management;Market Analysis;Product Analysis
Product.Strategy: Positioning and product definition;Sourcing;Business case and costing;Pricing
roadmap.detailing: There is some correlation between time and level of detail but the detailing of the items is not done systematically.
roadmap.items: Mainly product vision, customer and business goals, products, features and for the long-term timeframe themes (i.e., high-level customer needs)
roadmap.confidence: The impacts are mainly estimated by experts
roadmap.discovery: Product roadmap items are mainly defined based on expert knowledge.
roadmap.prioritization: Prioritization is done with an established process and focuses on delivering value to customers and the business.
roadmap.alignment: No alignment. No one or only one stakeholder such as high level management has a product roadmap that is not communicated to others.
roadmap.ownership: Ownership is shared between multiple roles
info.sources: Professional training org? (e.g. 280Group or Product Focus)

roadmap.detailing: Short-term items are detailed, prioritized, estimated and validated. Mid-term items are under validation or being discovered. The long-term timeframe contains themes.

roadmap.prioritization: Prioritization is based on the capability to deliver (e.g., low hanging fruits)

Job.title: Head of Product/VP/Director/CPO
Product.Strategy: Positioning and product definition;Delivery model & Service strategy;Business case and costing;Ecosystem management
Development: Project requirements engineering;User experience design;Quality Management
Service...Support: Service planning and preparation;Service provisioning;Sales support
roadmap.detailing: Short-term items are detailed, prioritized, estimated and validated. Mid-term items are under validation or being discovered. The long-term timeframe contains themes.
roadmap.items: Mainly customer and business goals, products, features and for the long-term timeframe topics (e.g., smart home)
roadmap.confidence: The impacts are mainly estimated by experts
roadmap.discovery: Several discovery activities are conducted (e.g., user research) but they are not or only loosely integrated with  delivery  activities.
